{"step_by_step_thinking": "Oil Red O is a fat-soluble dye used for staining of lipids, lipoproteins, and triglycerides on frozen sections and some lipoproteins on paraffin sections. It does not work well with formalin, alcohol, or glutaraldehyde fixed specimens because these methods of fixation can remove or alter the lipids that Oil Red O is designed to stain.", "answer_choice": "D"}
